name: Waikiki Resort

reviews.title: Good value - Great location
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Hawaii. I generally do extensive research before we travel and will comment on our own experiences and supply some opinions on previous reviews.

reviews.title: Very happy with our stay
reviews.text: The Hotel: Is somewhat dated but appeared to be clean and safe for anyone travelling on a budget. I used the free WiFi in the Lobby and it was suitable for my needs. We were on the 4th floor (Room 404) away from the elevators. It was a small room but adequate. The washroom door opened on to the toilet bowl - no big deal. Street noise was OK but it is located in an active area, there is always something going on. Door slams from other rooms were annoying but I think this was more a factor of inconsiderate patrons. There are ways to close your door to limit noise. On windy days the lanai door rattled as did the adjoining room door. Stuffed a folded piece of paper in the crack - problem solved. People were up and about very early to catch tour busses, thats just they way it is on holidays, good luck on trying to sleep in (bring ear plugs). Maid service was good and they were extremely friendly. Front counter service was adequate. As previously mentioned this hotel caters to Korean Airlines flight crews and Korean visitors. They tend to keep to themselves and seemed to go out of their way not to interact with other Patrons?

reviews.title: An adequate hotel in an excellent location
reviews.text: Location: Excellent. Close to all amenities. Stores, restaurants and bus stops. ABC stores everywhere. Varied selection of restaurants, budget and higher end. "The bus" system is good, used alot by tourists and locals. You can get schedules on-line or from the McDonald's restaurant 1 block towards the beach. Be patient on the bus it is cheap but not speedy. If you choose to rent a car use www.discounthawaiicarrental.com they have a Budget Car Rental office 1 block away at the Hyatt regency Hotel on the second floor. Rented a car for 2 individual days and drove the North shore. I did not want to pay the high car parking fees.

reviews.title: great location and value
reviews.text: Misc: Stayed on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki Beach. Not as busy. Snorkelled and saw a large variety of fish. Bring water shoes as the bottom is rocky. Bishops Museum was good as i learned alot of Hawaiin history and the Geology of the Island. Pearl Harbour was Ok. I enjoyed the displays before the USS Arizona memorial the best. North Shore was lovely and more layed back. Snorkeled at Kuilima Cove (Turtle Bay) and had Shrimp Scampi at Giovanni's Shrimp truck, just past (East) of the Turtle Bay turn off. Used Speedy Shuttle to get to and from the airport. Very good service. Snorkelling at Hanauma Bay was good. Saw green sea turtles, eels and a large variety of fish. Take bus #22 on Kuhio street. The bus tends to fill up. Best to walk westward on Kuhio a few blocks to ensure you can sit down on the bus instead of standing.

reviews.title: Great Location & Value
reviews.text: Thats it! Hope this helps.

reviews.title: My favorite hotel
reviews.text: Every time I am on O'ahu, I stay at Waikiki Resort. The employees are friendly, helpful, and savvy; parking uncomplicated; business center, laundry room, and Internet access is available. There is a great cafe and sushi/bar lounge downstairs, spa, and pool. The rooms are large and have kitchenettes- microwave, fridge, sink, dishes, and utensils. The hotel is situated half a city block from the main boulevard and the beach on a street not crowded by tourists.

reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Waikiki before moving on the Maui. They offered a special online discount. Pay for 2 nights get the 3rd free which helped me to decide on this hotel as the other hotels in the area were so expensive, and I was not there to spend time in my room. The 18th floor room had a good view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach and the ocean. The room was very tired looking. The carpet and bedding has seen better days and we did make sure to keep our shoes on when walking on the carpet. We booked a junior suite and it was good size and had a small kitchenette which we used to keep cold drinks and snacks in and to make coffe and tea in the morning. Bathroom was in dire need of an update. The location was very close to everything in Waikiki. I did find the staff pleasant and helpful and buffett breakfast was good but would get boring if you ate there everyday for a week, as it didn't change at all. I did hear some traffic noise at night but we were in the middle of a big city, so it is to be expected and it wasn't bad enought to keep us up.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: We did try the pool one afternoon and it is not heated and was so cold we didn't get past our toes. Since I paid alot of money to go to Hawaii the last thing I wanted was a polar bear dip!

reviews.title: Very enjoyable
reviews.text: All in all it was an OK hotel and served the purpose, but I think the management should look at replacing the bedding and carpets and freshing up the decor.

reviews.title: The staff is why we are going back again
reviews.text: Great location, well priced clean basic hotel. Helpful staff, parking available. Laundry available. I didn't use the pool because it is so close to the beach! Nearby restaurants, board rentals. A very nice hotel and vacation

reviews.title: Cheap for Hawaii, but it's not worth it
reviews.text: Checking in - slow since they only had one person staffed at the front helping people. The person who did check us in was almost brusque in that she really just wanted us all out of her hair. She never smiled once, in fact, no hotel staff ever smiled at us.

reviews.title: Good Quality Inexpensive Accommodation
reviews.text: The room - It is VERY dated, white varnish furniture from the 80's. Everything was clean, but cheap and uncomfortable. The first problem came here - the bedding had holes in it. We called to ask for new bedding and were told that they could not accomodate that. That's all they said, and anything else I said was given a response of "we can not accmodate that" - as if that was all the English she knew.

reviews.title: Fair Pricing!
reviews.text: Second problem - the gauge for the AC, or the thing that lets you control how cold it gets in the room did not work. we turned it to one end and did other stuff for half an hour and nothing changed, then we turned it to the other end and left for 2 hrs and nothing changed. We called about that and they said they could get someone to come and fix it in two days. We were only staying another two nights and so just said they can do whatever they want.

reviews.title: They stole my laptop
reviews.text: Third problem - the fridge, the old mini-fridge that they said their rooms would have. well, they had one. it just didn't work. we asked for them to take a look at it and maybe fix it and surprise, they sent someone to look at it. well, the person said that we were right, it didn't work. but they wouldn't be able to put another one into the room for a week or so.

reviews.title: Waikiki Resort was nice
reviews.text: On the plus side - they did a thorough job of cleaning the room everyday since we did track in a good deal of sand.

reviews.title: Great location and nice staff
reviews.text: I had stayed here several years ago and found it to be decent so I rebooked for my husband and I for our visit to Honolulu from Jan 12th - Jan 15th. Our room was on the 17th floor facing the mountains and we had a great view. They've made some renovations and our room was again decent but the bath had no tub just a small shower. The room was roomy with 2 full beds and we had cable TV. Around the corner from the elevators so it was pretty quiet except when the neighbors came in at 1 am. They did charge us $15/day for parking which surprised me since the last time I stayed it was only $8/day. There is no free wireless here or anywhere on the island that I'm aware of. You have to pay at least $9/dy for it but I was able to sign up for 3 dys/$13 with one of the wirless providers, just hunt for the discounted rates. The biggest plus about this hotel is it's a block away from the beach so just walk a short distance and you're there. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
reviews.text: This was our first time in Honolulu and we were very disappointed in this hotel. We requested a room on an upper floor away from the elevator and where did we end up? On a middle floor right next to the elevator. They could not change our room for two days. The hotel was undergoing renovations and we were told they would be complete 12/31/07. On 12/27/07 it was tough to tell what,if anything, had been renovated... definately not the rooms. They nickel and dimed us on everything. If you wanted a hair dryer it was $1/day extra. If you wanted an iron, it was $1/day extra. The parking was $15/day extra and there was a problem with the parking ticket and gate everytime we entered or exited. We were finally moved to a different room. There was a slight view of the ocean, but the room itself was still small and out of date. Some of the customer service reps were helpful, others were crabby. The price was reasonable (for Hawaii), but this hotel was not worth the price.

reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE - It is not worth it
reviews.text: We arrived late evening after a 10.5 hours flight looking forward to a great night sleep then up and about to explore the next day. When I say we, it was a mate and myself, so we had booked a Twin Room.

reviews.title: Fine Location, Although Noisy
reviews.text: We were given the key and opened the door and practically looking at the other side of the room. It was a 3m x 3m dog box with 2 single beds in it. There was no room to put luggage and we had to put the chair from the desk on the fridge so we could make some room. You had to step over a bed to get to the bathroom.

reviews.title: Value, location can't be beat in Waikiki
reviews.text: We complained the next day and were told it would cost extra to upgrade, however there were no other rooms in the hotel.

OK hotel would be a 4 star if they would let you check in your room early 3:00 check in means 3:00 after traveling all day you want to go to your room and rest. Front desk was also a little rude. House keeping was great. Hotel is close to the beach and all night life. other wise we had fun and would stay at this hotel again (good 4 the price) just dont plan on doing your laundry there cause all washers and dryers are broke
reviews.title: OK hotel close to all nightlife and beach
Great Place
reviews.text: This place is paradise. The restauarants serve great food - you should check out Seoul Jung ask for Ms. Woo to assist you - she gave us the best service. All of the employees are the greatest assisted us on many occasions. I would recommend staying here.

reviews.title: what a great place to stay
reviews.text: we just got back from waikiki and we stayed at the waikiki resort hotel for 2 1/2 weeks. This is our third time here and it has just been renovated. The room we were in had new carpet, new king size bed, new paint and it was great. It also had a new flat screen tv that was on the wall and freed up the counter space. I love the location of this hotel. It is so close to the beach. The staff is very friendly and always have a smile for us. We will be going back there next year for sure.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, very well located (2 min walk to the beach). It is highly recommended to book the room with the sea view as it is really worth the money. The view from the balcony is fantastic.

reviews.title: Just fine for us. Great stay.
reviews.text: The rooms are quite small but cosy and nicely decorated in hawaiian style.

reviews.title: Best deal in Waikiki
reviews.text: This hotel is great for the price. I was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the other reviews on this site. We booked a package deal with flight through a tour provider, so I don’t know what the rates were. I’m guessing they were about $100 a night for 6 nights in mid-February. We were primarily there for the Police concerts (which ROCKED btw) so the hotel didn’t concern us much. It’s not like we were on our honeymoon, and we don’t typically stay at plush places anyway. As long as the hotel is safe, clean and quiet, we are OK. The Waikiki Resort Hotel was all three.

reviews.title: OK for the price
reviews.text: Prior to arriving, I’d emailed the hotel’s customer service department and asked for a room away from the elevator because I ALWAYS end up near the elevator. When we got there, the room they initially assigned to us was on the 9th floor directly across from the elevator. As soon as we got in the room, I called the front desk and explained my earlier request. They moved us to another room right away. They even let me look at it first (with a security guard). In fact, Adam at the front desk was very helpful. We took the second room on the 18th floor. It was Penthouse E. But before you get excited, the penthouse is the same as other rooms. Nothing different. We had two full beds and a fridge. The room was clean, as was the whole hotel.

reviews.title: We loved it again
reviews.text: We stayed again and we were not disappointed. The staff were again great. It's close to everything clean and a good bang for your buck. We will be back again next year. Again thanks to Susie.

reviews.title: Five for Five
reviews.text: Just spent ten days at the Waikiki Resort, this was our fifth time there and I must say they are five for five in our books.

reviews.title: Waikiki Resort Hotel, waikiki , oahu
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were treated like family.

reviews.title: The Spirit of Aloha
reviews.text: When we arrived we were met by Branden and Nancy who have been there since our first visit so it was nice to catch up.

reviews.title: Disappointing compared to the other reviews
reviews.text: The first morning we looked forward to seeing our good friend Gary at the Bell desk, he is always happy to see return guests and always takes the time to say hello.

reviews.title: Great Place to stay
reviews.text: Have you ever gone to a hotel and felt like you had just come home. That is the feeling my wife and i have every time we come to the Waikiki Resort hotel. We started coming to this hotel in 2005 and have been there 7 times since. Every year the hotel has been improved with renovated rooms to new bedding but that is only part of the reason to stay there. The biggest reason is the staff. They never seem to change. They were friendly in 2005 and even more friendly when we got there in early March this year. There are so many faces that are the same as in 2005 and all seem to remember us every year(June and Erna have been there a long time and always can give a history lesson). The location is fantastic and the cost is reasonable so i recommend that everyone give it a try. This year our family came with us to meet our Hawaiian resort family and they had a great time.Thanks to the staff for a great vacation and we will see you next year.

reviews.title: Wonderful room
reviews.text: Just got back and had to comment on this hotel, we spent a week here and will be back. We had room 1115 and the partial ocean view was great, watched the surfers while having our morning coffee, turned to the left and had a great view of Diamond Head. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The balcony was larger than other hotels we tried and the cleaning staff washed them down everyday to ensure that the local birds did not leave us any presents. My husband enjoyed the TV as it was March Madness after all. The front desk was great for checkin and check out. Location was awesome, just a short walk to the beach, 10 minutes to the international market, 20 minutes to Diamond Head. There were 2 restaurants but we did not try either. We will be back and will try for a room a little higher up but if not 1115 will do just fine.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay here. The staff was very helpful. It seems to cater to Korean visitors so we felt a little out of place. Good location. Able to walk to most Waikiki locations. Security was very helpful.

reviews.title: AUSSIE AUSSIE AUSSIE
reviews.text: gday everybody,,, a mate of mine decided to get married in hawaii.. so being an average punter with a couple of kids i thought this is gunna hurt( financially) so i got on the tripadvisor sight and looked and looked and looked... WE stayed at this resort for the first half of our stay 4 days there .. the other 4 days hilton hawaiin village.. By staying at this resort we saved enough to allow a few days at a fancy place..this place was EXCELLENT location..mcdonalds for the kids about 1 minute ... beach 2 minutes.. As soon as you walk in you got greeted a lovely smile..no problem attitude,,very nice front desk..The rooms were ordinary looking but very clean and the beds were as good as the fancy hotel.You can wash your clothes down stairs for 2 dollars. park the car undercover for 20 bucks which is good by hawaiin standards.You dont wait for the lifts like the fancy hotels.Everything you need is a slingshot away..Next time i go to Hawaii i will stay there for the whole stay and spend my money on better things then a bed..(fancy hotel).. When your in hawaii you want to get out and explore the island,, do things.. come back to a nice clean bed!!! this is that place.. ..free wifi in lobby... a small clean pool if you wanted a dip..this place never felt crowded.. go to the abc shops which are like little convenience shops.. good value.. hard rock made great burgers.. tony romanos was a great rib joint that was tasty..plenty of places to eat and drink.If you want to go and swim at the fancy hotels just throw your towel over your shoulder and walk on in...you are allowed.... by a cocktail sit down..relax. hire a car from alamo for $480 dollars fully insured for everything for 4 days.....jeep cherokee soft top.. the other 4 days caught the bus which was easy as..Anyways i could tell you all about our holiday .... but rest assured you will not go wrong staying here!!!!!!!!! queensland mick........aloha..haha

reviews.title: Very nice place to stay, close to every thing.
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay there, it's close to every where, beach, Shopps, every thing.

reviews.title: An absolute bargain!
reviews.text: Stayed at the WRH from the 8th to the 14th Sept 2007.

reviews.title: great location and underated hotel.
reviews.text: Our room was clean and cheap, which is pretty much all we wanted.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: The hotel is central to everything you want to do whilst in the Waikiki area...they are working on the hotel at the moment, but we wern't inconvenienced in any way - they shut the water off for a few hours the morning we were leaving, that's all.

reviews.title: Mid-level hotel, OK for a short stay
reviews.text: If you're looking to save some money, this should be your choice. Are you going to Hawaii to spend time in a hotel room? If so, choose somewhere else. If you want to be out and about, this place is just fine as a base and a place to sleep.

reviews.title: nervous after reading reviews
reviews.text: Waikiki itself is VERY busy and commercial, if you're imagining an island paradise, i'd say definitely spend a few days or more on the North Shore - at the Turtle Bay Hilton. There are still plenty of natural activities to do close by to Waikiki, but due to the amount of people around the area, you aren't likely to be alone.

description: Reputable for its outstanding value and convenience in location, this 275 room hotel is ideally located just steps from famous Waikiki Beach and nearby dining and shopping. This full-service hotel features comfortable guestrooms, meeting rooms, event facilities, two restaurants, a bar lounge, and a swimming pool. Just recently refurbished, each guest room features air conditioning, 32" flat panel TV, compact refrigerator, coffee-maker, internet access (fee), iron and board, voice mail, and safe. The lobby features complimentary wi-fi access, a business center, and an Expedia concierge desk.
